about_the_game:
"Imagine a world that defies the laws of space known to us. A world that is created by itself, by the will of nature, without the intervention of any man and other creatures. It breaks everything we know about mass and space. Elementary particles, gravity, geometry - all this works here not the way we used to."



Density Limit is a cinematic investigation adventure game with an ordinary story in a surreal place. Your mission is to find out what happened here, why this space even exists and who’s to blame for the mess here.

Welcome to the Unspace

It's a whole new state-of-the-art world that was created by the nature itself with the help of the greatest minds. It has its own aesthetics and laws of geometry and physics. There is no upside or downside here, left is right and one step forward is one mile back. Forget about tryouts to make a map or to memorize the way back. The scientists tried to curb the Unspace and they paid a very high price.

You're only a human

This maze of concrete and glass had no builders. It was architected and designed by itself. You're just a detective and this is your crime scene.
Your mission is to find out what is this place, what happened here and why does it even exists? So much questions, but you will not hear any answers, because witnesses are very far away, but on the other side of that wall at the same time.

name: Density Limit

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10
  • DirectX: Version 11
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 11
  • DirectX: Version 12

short_description: Welcome to the Unspace. Not gonna lie, it’s a little scary there, but it’s very attractive for scientists and kind of mysterious as well. But what is the limit of this space? What happened here and why does it even exist? Your mission will be to solve this case.
supported_languages:
English*, Polish, Ukrainian*, Lithuanian
*languages with full audio support
